channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘October 7: In Their Own Words’ Gives Kennedy Center Audience Permission To Remember
item.description: October 7 offers something rare: moral clarity without instruction, faith without propaganda, and testimony without shame.

item.title: ICE keeps getting slapped down by a George W. Bush-appointed, Antonin Scalia acolyte Republican judge in Minnesota
item.description: “ICE is not a law unto itself,” wrote Judge Patrick Schiltz, who has also asked ICE's acting director to explain why he shouldn't be held in contempt.

item.description: Plus, a great Caravaggio and Bellini as special guests.

item.title: Remove Tesla’s non-repeatable profits, and the stock has never been more expensive—now boasting a ‘core’ PE of 632

item.title: The Dangerous Allure of Assisted Suicide
item.description: The establishment of a duty not to be burdensome in a society with legal suicide and our upside-down demographics is a recipe for mass murder.
